sentences.en: He had the grace to apologize to me for the insulting remark.
sentences.cn: 由于说话失礼,他通情达理地向我道了歉.

sentences.en: He was curt and to the point without being rude or insulting.
sentences.cn: 他说话简单扼要,一语中的,既不粗俗,也不盛气凌人.

sentences.en: He was dismissed for publicly insulting prominent politicians.
sentences.cn: 他在大庭广众之下辱骂政坛显贵,结果被撤职了.

sentences.en: He was galled by her insulting language.
sentences.cn: 他被她侮辱性的语言激怒了.

sentences.en: How insulting! His insolence is beyond belief.
sentences.cn: 太无礼了! 他那蛮横无礼的态度难以令人置信.

sentences.en: It does not become you to use insulting words like that!
sentences.cn: 你用那样恶语伤人太不合适了!

sentences.en: It was the most unfair and insulting mistake.
sentences.cn: 这是不公道的,侮辱性的错误.

sentences.en: Nobody gets away with insulting me like that.
sentences.cn: 这样侮辱我的人,我是不会放过的.

sentences.en: One of the apprentices made an insulting remark to a passing officer.
sentences.cn: 其中一名学徒对着一名路过的警官说了一句侮辱他的话。

sentences.en: She was really insulting to me.
Some of them were impudent and insulting.
sentences.cn: 他们当中的一些人放肆无礼，目中无人。

sentences.en: The article was insulting to the families of British citizens.
sentences.cn: 那篇文章侮辱了英国公民家庭。

sentences.en: The insulting remarks stung him to a rage.
sentences.cn: 这些侮辱性的话惹得他大怒起来.

sentences.en: Their behaviour may seem insulting, but it's important not to rise to the bait and get cross.
sentences.cn: 他们的行为看起来可能很无礼，但千万不要上当生气。

sentences.en: Their insulting remarks were a provocation.
sentences.cn: 他们侮辱人的话使人愤怒.

words.tran_cn: 侮辱的，无礼的；污蔑的；损害人体的

phrases.tran_cn: 雪上加霜；伤害之外又加侮辱

trans.tran_cn: 出言不逊的，侮辱的，无礼的
trans.tran_en: very rude and offensive to someone

trans.tran_cn: 侮辱，冒犯( insult的现在分词)
